avalancheActivity.comment:
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in isolated cases and mostly by large additional loads. This applies in particular in little used terrain, caution is to be exercised on very steep shady slopes at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example above approximately 2300 m.
The avalanches can be released in the faceted old snow and reach medium size.
The avalanche prone locations are rather rare but are barely recognisable, even to the trained eye.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2300 m. Weak layers in the old snowpack are treacherous.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack in particular on shady slopes above the tree line.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.

In particular steep sunny slopes as well as below approximately 1900 m: As a consequence of mild temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface during the last few days.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas at elevated altitudes hardly any snow is lying.

At low altitude from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche prone locations are very rare.
On very steep shady slopes only isolated dry avalanches are possible, but they will be mostly small.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In all altitude zones from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The old snowpack is faceted and weak.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Also at intermediate and high altitudes hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in isolated cases and mostly by large additional loads, caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 2 (moderate).

Thus far only isolated mostly small dry and moist avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in steep terrain at elevated altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The wind slabs of last week are lying on unfavourable layers in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2200 m. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Also at intermediate and high altitudes thus far only a little snow is lying.
